116.description: The door has closed. For this event to be generated, the door must be equipped with a door sensor.

117.description: The door has opened. For this event to be generated, the door must be equipped with a door sensor.

120.description: Someone has pressed the door release button or has triggered a request to exit motion detector.

122.description: In Security Desk, a user has manually locked a door.

123.description: In Security Desk, a user has manually reset to normal work mode a door.

124.description: The door is considered locked in Security Center.

126.description: The door has been taken out of maintenance mode.

127.description: The door has been put into maintenance mode.

128.description: Someone has pulled the door emergency release (manual pull station).

129.event: Manual station reverted to normal state
129.description: The door emergency release (manual pull station) has been restored to it normal operating position.

130.description: The schedule for controlled access to elevator floors now applies.

132.description: The schedule for denied access to elevator floors now applies.

133.event: Schedule unlock ignored: first-person-in rule supervisor absent
133.description: The door unlock schedule is ignored because the restriction imposed by the first-person-in rule has not yet been satisfied.

135.event: Access Point mode Free exit / Lock entry
135.description: Access point change mode to  Free exit / Lock entry

136.event: Access Point mode Free exit / Controlled entry
136.description: Access point change mode to  Free exit / Controlled entry

137.event: Access Point mode Free exit / Free entry
137.description: Access point change mode to  Free exit / Free entry

172.description: A firmware upgrade on an access control unit has failed.

173.description: A firmware upgrade on an access control unit has been started.

174.description: A firmware upgrade on an access control unit has completed successfully.

180.description: The interface module has come online.

183.description: The synchronization of the unit with the Access Manager has failed.

184.description: The synchronization of the unit with the Access Manager has started.

185.description: The synchronization of the unit with the Access Manager has completed successfully.

271.description: Parking time has been purchased through connected pay stations or mobile apps.

272.description: The convenience time portion of the parking session has begun.

273.description: The vehicle has exited the parking zone.

274.description: The vehicle has entered the parking zone.

275.description: The inventory of a parking zone has been reset to zero so that the reported parking zone occupancy can be re-initialized.

276.description: The convenience time or the paid time has expired for the parking session.

301.description: Execution of a macro has begun.

302.description: Execution of a macro has been completed normally.

303.description: A custom event is an event added after the initial system installation. Events defined at system installation are called system events. Custom events can be user-defined or automatically added through plugin installations. Unlike system events, custom events can be renamed and deleted.

4.description: The cardholder is denied because the area is at its occupancy limit.

6.event: Access denied: First-person-in rule supervisor absent
6.description: The first-person-in rule has been enforced on the area, and no supervisor has arrived yet.

8.description: Access is denied because of an interlock constraint.

19.description: A security operator has granted access to a cardholder responsible for a passback violation.

20.description: In the 2 Credentials access mode.The cardholder not entered second credential.

21.description: In the 2 Credentials access mode.The cardholder entered second credtntial with timeout.

66.description: The zone capacity has reached the capacity minimum threshold

67.description: The zone capacity has reached the capacity maximum threshold

68.description: The number of people counted in an zone has been reset to 0.

69.description: A cardholder has entered an empty zone.

70.description: The last cardholder has exited an zone.

73.description: Interlock lockdown has been turned on.

74.description: Interlock lockdown has been turned off.

77.event: A door of an interlock has an unlock schedule configured
77.description: A door that is part of an interlock configuration has an unlock schedule configured.

78.event: A door of an interlock is in maintenance mode
78.description: A door that is part of an interlock configuration is in maintenance mode.

79.event: An interlock cannot be in hard antipassback mode
79.description: An interlock cannot be in hard antipassback mode. This is an illegal configuration.

80.event: An interlock cannot have a perimeter door with no door sensor configured
80.description: Interlock cannot be enforced if the system cannot tell whether a door is open or not.

81.event: An interlock cannot have only one perimeter door
81.description: You need at least two perimeter doors for interlock to be applied.

82.description: Dead man check timer gone out

118.description: The door is locked but the door sensor indicates that the door is open.

119.description: The door has been held open for too long.

121.description: In Security Desk, a user has manually unlocked a door.

131.description: The schedule for free access to elevator floors now applies.

134.description: One or more devices associated to this door has gone offline.

138.description: Access point change mode to   Antipanic

170.description: The tamper input on a unit has been triggered.

175.event: Interface module AC fail state active
175.description: The AC (alternating current) of an interface module has failed.

176.event: Interface module AC fail state restored
176.description: The AC (alternating current) of an interface module has been restored.

177.event: Interface module battery fail state active
177.description: The battery of an interface module has failed.

178.event: Interface module battery fail state restored
178.description: The battery of an interface module has been restored.

179.description: The interface module has gone offline.

181.description: The tamper input of an interface module has been triggered.

182.description: The tamper input of an interface module has returned to normal.

217.description: An alarm has been acknowledged by a user, or auto-acknowledged by the system.

218.description: An alarm with a acknowledgment condition that is still active has been put into the under investigation state.

219.description: The acknowledgment condition of an alarm has been cleared.

277.description: The convenience time, the grace period, or the paid time has expired for the parking session.

278.description: The vehicle in violation has been ticketed.

300.description: Execution of a macro has failed.

304.description: A threat level has been cleared.

305.description: A threat level has been set.

22.description: A cardholder was granted access to a door or area, and it is assumed that they entered because no door sensor is configured.

23.description: A cardholder was granted access to a door or area, and their entry is detected. For this event to be generated, you must configure an entry sensor on the door side where you want entry to be detected. If no Entry Sensors are configured on the door, the event will be generated based on the Door Sensor input.

24.description: Access has been granted through a door to a cardholder according to the access rules governing the door, elevator, or area.

1.description: A cardholder requested access to an area that they have already entered, or requested access to leave an area that they were never in.

2.event: Access denied: A second cardholder is required
2.description: Two cardholders must present their credentials within a certain delay of each other and the delay has expired. This event only applies to doors controlled by Synergis™ units.

3.event: Access denied: Denied by access rule
3.description: The cardholder is denied access according to the access rule.

5.description: An expired credential has been used.

7.description: A cardholder with an inactive profile has attempted to access a door or elevator.

9.description: The cardholder entered an invalid PIN.

10.description: The cardholder entered an invalid RFID.

11.description: The cardholder entered an invalid BT PHONE.

12.description: The cardholder entered an invalid LINKEY.

13.description: The cardholder entered an invalid VIKEY.

14.description: A credential that has been declared as lost has been used.

15.description: A credential that has been declared as stolen has been used.

16.description: A credential that is unknown in the Security Center system has been used.

17.description: The access rule associated with this cardholder does not apply during the date or time specified in the schedule.

18.description: An access request was made to enter an area with a credential that is already inside the area, or to exit an area with a credential that was never in the area.
